France's greenhouse gas emissions stopped declining in the first quarter of 2025
subhead: Carbon emission rates stayed almost flat (+0.2%) from January to March and are set to drop by only 0.8% over 2025, according to the CITEPA nonprofit tasked with calculating emissions. This pace falls far short of climate targets.

title: Since October 7, more Jewish families in the Paris region 'want to move to a place they perceive as safer'
Trump flexes political muscle with passage of ‘big and beautiful’ budget
French air traffic controllers' strike intensifies, 40% of flights canceled at Paris airports
subhead: Tens of thousands of passengers had to rearrange their plans as widespread disruption continued in airports across France on Friday, the second day of a strike by air traffic controllers demanding better working conditions.

title: Corsican mafia undergoing 'major recomposition,' intelligence report says
subhead: According to French crime investigators, new power balances are emerging between two blocs on the Mediterranean island: the Petit Bar gang and the Mattei clan, which is uniting groups from various regions.

title: Art weaves a thread between Paris and the Ukrainian front line
subhead: French-based painter Polina Moroz asked a compatriot, an embroiderer mobilized in the Ukrainian army, to contribute to her canvases. These odes to summer and peace are now on display in Marseille.

title: Since October 7, more Jewish families in the Paris region 'want to move to a place they perceive as safer'
subhead: The rise in anti-Semitism has accelerated the ongoing shift in where Jews live in Paris and its suburbs, home to about half of France's estimated 500,000 Jews.

title: Water shortages in the upper Indian Himalayas are causing 'villages to die out and traditions to disappear'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating'  (4/6). Zanskar, located in the Ladakh region of India's mountain highlands, has felt the full force of glacier retreat. With no access to water, villagers have been abandoning their homes and traditional way of life.
byline: By Sophie Landrin (Padum (Ladakh, India) special correspondent)

title: In Germany, Syrians still do not feel fully assimilated
subhead: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (2/5). Thanks to former chancellor Angela Merkel's asylum policy, Germany has taken in nearly half the Syrians seeking refuge in Europe since 2015. One of them, Amer Alqadi, a 39-year-old married father and naturalized citizen, believes that while the country still needs immigrants, its political climate has grown more tense.
byline: By Julia Pascual (Berlin, special correspondent) and Samuel Gratacap (Photos)

title: Far-right RN and allies face new embezzlement scandal at European Parliament
subhead: The now-defunct far-right Identity and Democracy group, which included Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National, misused €4.3 million in operating funds, according to a confidential report revealed by Le Monde and its partners.
byline: By Jérémie Baruch, Clément Guillou, Anne Michel, Vincent Nouvet and Maxime Vaudano
